diff_hunk:
@@ -616,9 +616,32 @@ RegisterOperators reg2({
     DEFINE_BINARY_OP(aten::add, a + b)
     DEFINE_BINARY_OP(aten::sub, a - b)
     DEFINE_BINARY_OP(aten::mul, a * b)
-    DEFINE_BINARY_OP(aten::div, a / b)
     DEFINE_BINARY_OP(aten::pow, static_cast<decltype(a)>(pow(a, b)))
 
+    // TODO: Support python floordiv (//)
+    // Right now prim::FloorDiv is only used by loop unrolling
+    DEFINE_INT_OP(prim::FloorDiv, a / b)
body: I think it is more consistent to call it `aten::floor_div` along with all the other math ops.  I want to get to the place where the only things marked `prim::` are ops that have special behavior in optimization passes (e.g. control flow, and constants)
body_html: I think it is more consistent to call it aten::floor_div along with all the other math ops. I want to get to the place where the only things marked prim:: are ops that have special behavior in optimization passes (e.g. control flow, and constants)
